p: It is known that inhibition of prolyl oligopeptidase (POP) might be effective in memory-related function ( 40). Rosmarinic acid (1, 2, 4, or 8 mg/kg, PO) for acute (4 training days) or 2 or 3 weeks sub-chronic periods inhibited POP activity and therefore showed a cognitive- improving effect in mice ( 41). These cognitive-enhancing effects of rosmarinic acid might be beneficial to populations of advanced age.
